name: Massimo Bottura
description: Massimo Bottura is an Italian restaurateur and the chef patron of Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-star restaurant based in Modena, Italy ranked No.1 on The World's 50 Best Restaurants list twice and currently part of the Best of the Best list. Massimo Bottura was born and raised in Modena, Italy. He developed an interest in cooking from a young age while watching his mother, grandmother and aunt in the kitchen, preparing meals for the family.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
method: Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Arrange mozzarella cheese slices on top.
Bake pizza for 10-12 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
method: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
In a skillet, cook pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Drain spaghetti and reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Add spaghetti and reserved pasta water to skillet with pancetta.
Remove skillet from heat and pour in egg mixture, tossing pasta until coated.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan
method: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
In a mixing bowl, combine breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumb mixture.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to a baking dish and top each breast with tomato sauce and a slice of mozzarella cheese.
Bake chicken for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let chicken cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Giada De Laurentiis
description: Chef Giada De Laurentiis, one of the best chefs from Italy. She was born in Rome in 1970 and moved to the United States when she was 7 years old. You may recognize Chef Giada from her 2021 cooking show called Bobby and Giada in Italy, where she prepares delicious Italian dishes on TV. Before her television debut, however, Giada Laurentiis started her cooking expertise in her grandfather’s kitchen as she would help him cook in her younger years. From there she was able to observe how food is prepared and all the other stuff that make a good cook. It was also during the time of her grandfather’s restaurant DDL Foodshow, where Laurentiis really grasped the qualities and traits of Italian cuisine.

recipes.name: Lasagna
method: brown ground beef and mix with tomato sauce
layer lasagna noodles, meat sauce, ricotta cheese,and mozzarella cheese
repeat until all ingredients are used up, top with parmesan cheese

recipes.name: Risotto
method: Sauté onion in butter, add rice and stir until toasted
add white wine and stir until absorbed
when the rice is cooked, add parmesan cheese and stir

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
method: Slice tomato and fresh mozzarella cheese
arrange alternately on a plate, top with fresh basil, drizzle olive oil and balsamic vinegar

name: Fabio Viviani
description: Fabio Viviani started his love for food at a very young age by working as a helper in a local bakery in his home city of Florence in Tuscany. He was only allowed to work there despite not being old enough to get employed because he was friends with the owner. From then on, he has worked in various restaurants. With his amazing cooking skills, Viviani became one of the youngest sous chefs in Italian history at the age of 16.

recipes.name: Osso Buco
method: add tomato paste, white wine, and beef broth
cover and simmer for a few hours

recipes.name: Minestrone Soup
method: Sauté onion, carrot, celery, and zucchini
add canned tomatoes, kidney beans, and vegetable broth
add pasta and cook until tender

recipes.name: Tiramisu
method: beat mascarpone cheese, eggs, and sugar

name: Gino D’Acampo
description: Chef Gino D’Acampo is known to be one of the few Italian chefs that brought the Italian cuisine – particularly from the south of Naples – to the world, especially to the United Kingdom. As the UK is famous for welcoming indigenous and foreign cooking masters, D’Acampo seized the opportunity to showcase the best of Italian cuisine. Having spread joy and devotion of food, D’Acampo has opened at least 11 branches of his restaurant named after him in the UK, where he serves his sumptuous dishes made with love – keeping it simple and traditional.

recipes.name: Bolognese Sauce
method: add canned tomatoes, beef broth, and red wine

recipes.name: Bruschetta
method: rub with garlic, top with diced tomato and chopped basil

recipes.name: Gnocchi
method: add flour, egg, parmesan cheese, and salt
boil in salted water until they float

name: Giorgio Locatelli
description: Chef Giorgio Locatelli and one would see the total seriousness this great Italian chef puts in his work. Well, that is only a fraction of the dedication he has for the profession. As everyone knows, Chef Giorgio Locatelli is largely a traditional Italian by heart. He was born in 1960 in the Northern Italian city of Vergiate, 45 km. northwest of Milan and some 15 km. southwest of Varese.

recipes.name: Arancini
method: insert a cube of mozzarella cheese

recipes.name: Cannoli
method: Mix ricotta cheese, powdered sugar, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and chocolate chips
fill cannoli shells with the mixture

recipes.name: Saltimbocca
method: Pound veal cutlets, top each with a slice of prosciutto and a sage leaf
roll up and secure with toothpicks

name: Carlo Cracco
description: Chef Carlo Cracco, who was born in Veneto region’s town of Creazzo in 1965. Rendering flamboyancy to the usual dish, Chef Carlo Cracco is likened to be adding fresh, innovative ideas – the reason why he was awarded Michelin stars multiple times in the restaurants that he has worked like L’Albereta and LeClivie. Chef Carlo appeared as a guest judge on MasterChef and Hell’s Kitchen.

recipes.name: Osso Buco
method: Brown veal shanks, sauté onion, carrot, and celery
add canned tomatoes, beef broth, and white wine

recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo
method: add heavy cream and parmesan cheese

recipes.name: Zuppa Toscana
method: add diced potatoes and chicken broth
